thread.title: Jared Leto and Mark Ruffalo Go Incognito at New York Comic Con
thread.title_full: Jared Leto and Mark Ruffalo Go Incognito at New York Comic Con

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Jared Leto and Mark Ruffalo Go Incognito at New York Comic Con
text:
Comments The Joker of 'Suicide Squad' and the Hulk depicter went undercover at the event, putting on masks to conceal their true identities. 
While there was no major presence or special panel for both " Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice " and " Suicide Squad " at New York Comic Con, star Jared Leto did participate in the event. Leto's fellow actor, Mark Ruffalo , also attended the event and they both came in disguise, wearing incognito masks to conceal their true identities. Donning their masks, Ruffalo and Leto walked around the Jacob Javits Center in Manhattan, where the event was held, took pictures with other cosplayers and uploaded some photos of their activities on social media. Leto wore a Baboon mask during the event to make fans do not realize that it was him. He uploaded a photo on Twitter which captures himself alongside one fan who was cosplaying as Leto's version of the Joker. "He had no idea. :) #NYCC2015," Leto captioned the photo. A photo posted by JARED LETO (@jaredleto) on Oct 11, 2015 at 2:28pm PDT — JARED LETO (@JaredLeto) October 11, 2015 Meanwhile, the Hulk depicter hid his face behind a caricature mask which looked like a 20th-century New York cab driver. Like Leto, Ruffalo also took pictures with visitors. He uploaded one of the photos on Instagram. It shows him taking a selfie with a boy. "Had a great time at #comiccon2015 NYC! Thanks ComicCon for the Hospitality," Ruffalo captioned the picture. A photo posted by Mark Ruffalo (@markruffalo) on Oct 10, 2015 at 3:20pm PDT A photo posted by Mark Ruffalo (@markruffalo) on Oct 10, 2015 at 3:18pm PDT Leto's the Joker will be seen in "Suicide Squad", which is scheduled for a U.S. release on August 5, 2016. Meanwhile, Ruffalo's Hulk is rumored to make appearance in " Thor: Ragnarok " before appearing in " Avengers: Infinity War Part I ", which will arrive Stateside on May 4, 2018.
